This game is an amazing shooter that just like Portal, incorporated physics based puzzles into first person games. Except this game did double and added it to a first person shooter! So, after Half Life 1 i now finshed the base game of Half Life 2 (The DLCs Episode 1 and 2 are following).

Half Life 2 amazes by a goerge orwell-ish atmosphere like in 1984. In the beginning it feels like you walk on a thin legal line and just one step in either direction turns you into a terrorist in the eyes of the ruling combine. It doesn't take long until exactly this happens. The immersion and atmosphere of a hunted revolutionist sticks on you like sweat. The level designs are unique and offer a variety of features.

Graphics are still okay, sounds are even better. Every sound effect or music track matches the scenery and atmosphere perfectly. Physics feel like the first testing ground for the portal series. They are nice but sometimes chaotic and frustrating. You can easily pick up a crate but it's nearly impossible to push it. Sometimes you have to be fast in HL2 and this kind of obstacles are unpleasent. Which leads to my greatest critic of Half Life 2: the controls. It's to much information to discribe every issue i experienced and tested. But it's not so well designed and intuitive like in Half Life. Another... question mark the game leaves for me is the somehow abrupt (but mysterious) ending.

Don't get me wrong. My critics are complaints on a high level. This game is still a video game of great overall quality.
Obra maestra... estoy impaciente por comprar unas gafas de realidad virtual y jugar half life alyx

Since I have no new Half-life products to play - I just play this one... over and over again. I can still remember overclocking my old Dell Optiplex and top of the line (in it's day) video card to get to play this game. Then I beat it - and nothing was ever the same. I surely wish someone could count to three with their video game titles; but I understand the idea behind development hell.
 A few of my favorite memories playing this game: hitting a combine grunt in the face with an aluminum can that it decided was a valuable lesson in obedience; dragging a mattress through the streets of Ravenholm and killing zombies by launching it at them; and finally, learning that Heady was named after Heady LaMarr - there are a lot of interesting experiences to be had in this game while playing with the physics engine.

 Thanks for the hours of playtime Valve.
Gunplay sucks, but the physics & ending rocks.
Still one of the best fps games around

Great game, still holds up to this day.

--- | GRAPHICS |---
‚òê Stunning
‚òê Good
‚òë Decent
‚òê Don‚Äòt look too long at it
‚òê Bad
Considering this game is more than 15 years old, there is nothing to complain about how this game looks. Surely newer games outclass HL2 in terms of resolution, animation and colour saturation, but its old look has something undeniably charming about it.

--- | GAMEPLAY| ---
‚òê Amazing
‚òë Good
‚òê Average
‚òê Meh
‚òê Awful
The mixture of different activities throughout the game - exploring, fighting, driving, sometimes simultaneously - they really make the gameplay shine.

--- | AUDIO | ---
‚òê Eargasm
‚òê Good
‚òë Not too bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê I'm now deaf
The sound is neither highlight nor weakness here.

--- | SINGLE-/MULTIPLAYER | ---
‚òë Singleplayer only
‚òê Mutliplayer available, but not preferred
‚òê Both work out fine
‚òê Predominantly Multiplayer
‚òê What even is Singleplayer?
This game doesn't need multiplayer, besides, it wouldn't fit anyway.

--- | PC REQUIREMENTS | ---
‚òë Potato will suffice
‚òê Below average
‚òê Decent
‚òê Rich boi
‚òê Ask NASA if they have a spare computer
Any laptop with shitty specs can run this without problems.

--- | DIFFICULTY | ---
‚òê Braindead clicking and pressing "W"
‚òê Fairly simple
‚òê Easy to learn / Hard to master
‚òë Difficult
‚òê Dark Souls
While the gameplay mechanics and controls are quite straightforward, some fights later in the game can be challenging. At some points you will have think more than once to figure what you need to do in order to advance.

--- | FRUSTRATION | ---
‚òê Nothing but relaxation and harmony
‚òë Occasional Anger
‚òê Feelings of accomplishment and frustration even each other out
‚òê You will be upset for a lot of time
‚òê Might as well open your own salt mine
Referring to the above, being stuck at one points in a level can be frustrating.

--- | GRIND | ---
‚òë Nothing to grind
‚òê Isnt necessary to progress
‚òê Average grind level
‚òê Too much grind
‚òê You‚Äòll need a second live for grinding
Well, all is said for that one.

--- | ACHIEVEMENTS |---
‚òê Just play the game and you will gather them easily
‚òë  You can get them by progressing in the game and keeping an eye out 
‚òê Some are easily obtained, others you will have to grind
‚òê They require you to commit a lot of time and skill
‚òê You can spend a lifetime trying to earn all of them
Many are story-related and can't even be missed, most of them are doable by exploring the areas and being creative with killing opponents. The one that requires you to find all Lamda signs really is the only one that takes up more time and awareness.


--- | STORY | ---
‚òê No Story
‚òê Some lore
‚òê Average
‚òë Good
‚òê It‚Äòll replace your life
You're a physicist fighting with rebels against a authoritarian/oppressive regime. Nothing special overall, but the details filling out the story make it pretty good.

--- | GAME TIME | ---
‚òê Long enough for a cup of coffee
‚òë Short
‚òê Average
‚òê Long
‚òê To infinity and beyond
I made two whole playtroughs, about 20 hours total, and I don't see many reasons to play it any further once you completed the story (and maybe got all the achievements).

--- | PRICE | ---
‚òê It‚Äôs free!
‚òë Worth the price
‚òê Maybe on sale
‚òê Not recommended
‚òê You could also just burn your money
It's an all-time classic for a relatively cheap regular price, totally worth buying.

--- | BUGS | --- 
‚òê None at all
‚òë Minor bugs
‚òê Can get annoying
‚òê Lots of bugs
‚òê The game itself is a big terrarium for bugs
Just some glitches and stuff, nothing to worry about.

--- | OVERALL  | ---
‚òê Amazing
‚òë Good
‚òê OK
‚òê Bad
‚òê Waste of time and money
it was fun in the begining but then the game just got boring
